newsitem.title: FRANCE: No Havas news mag move before September - chairman.
newsitem.headline: No Havas news mag move before September - chairman.

text.p: Pierre Dauzier, chairman of French media group Havas, said the Havas board would not look at proposals to divest from weekly news magazines Le Point and L'Express until September.

He told the company's annual meeting on Thursday that he had discussed the sale of the news magazines with Jean-Marie Messier, the chairman of Havas's main shareholder, Compagnie Generale des Eaux (CGE).

He said he had asked managing director Eric Licoys, who was Messier's adviser before taking up his job at Havas this month, and Christian Bregou, chairman of Havas's publishing unit CEP Communication, to come up with recommendations for the Havas board to discuss.
"This proposal will not be made before September. We will not call an exceptional board meeting for that," he told journalists after the meeting.
L'Express and Le Point are the group's only general magazines, while the others grouped within CEP are specialist or leisure journals.
The two news magazines together have turnover of some 800 million francs, less than 10 percent of Havas's publishing turnover of 11.1 billion francs.

Messier's comments at his company's annual meeting recently, saying he hoped that the two magazines would be put up for sale, set off a wave of press articles. Dauzier said he was surprised at the press reaction.
